resources.string: is one of the most recognizable City icons. It is the central feature of the main market square in the Kraków Old Town
is one of the largest medieval town squares in Europe
is a Brick Gothic church adjacent to the Main Market Square in Kraków, Poland. Built in the 14th century
is a Roman Catholic church located on Wawel Hill in Kraków, Poland. More than 900 years old
is an complex erected over many centuries atop a limestone outcrop on the left bank of the Vistula river in Kraków
Florian Gate is one of the best-known Polish Gothic towers, and a focal point of Kraków
The Barbican is a fortified outpost once connected to the city walls.
The international air picnic in Krakow. It takes place in June in the old airport
The Wawel Castle is a castle residency located in central Kraków. Built at the behest of King Casimir III the Great.

The underground museum beneath the Main Square is an archaeological-architectural preserve. This unique complex occupies 3,300 m2, and exhibits traces of settlements from nomadic times and relics of medieval construction
The Collegium Maius located in Kraków Old Town, Poland, is the Jagiellonian University oldest building, dating back to the 14th century

Founded in 1946 and part of the Jagiellonian University, the Pharmacy Museum is one of the few museums of that type in the world. Exhibits collected here show the history of pharmacy from the Middle Ages to modern times.
The Cathedral has ammassed some unique treasures over the centuries, and here you can have a peak at some of the most intriguing.
A rare jewel of a museum with an extraordinary history to match. Famous of course for its Leonardo da Vinci
Museum Night is extremely popular venture both amongst inhabitants and tourists
Street Art International Street Theatre Festival
Over four summer days, you might suddenly find yourself in the middle of a theatre scene.
The Cracow Film Festival is one of Europe oldest events dedicated to documentary, animation and other short film forms.
Summer Jazz Festival at Piwnica Pod Baranami
Each year the Festival expanded presentions beside 31 everyday concert at the Piwnica club for more additional events at the Krakow
is an essential stop for those interested in experiencing high class Polish cuisine. Jozefa 14, Krakow
Located east of the Old Town, in the district of Nowa Huta, Stylowa is one of the most authentic restaurants in Krakow. Centrum C 3, Krakow
The menu offers lovingly prepared, mouth-watering delicacies of Polish cuisine such as homemade lard, Polish and Russian dumplings. Grodzka 35, Krakow
Cyrano de Bergerac ranks among the top restaurants in Krakow and is a treat for visitors looking for a French-style restaurant. Sławkowska 26, Krakow
